Each pair of complex conjugate eigenvalues expands to a quadratic factor:

The subgroup of $GL_n(\mathbf{R})$ consisting of matrices whose eigenvalues all have absolute value one is precisely **the set of matrices that are conjugate to block-diagonal matrices with $1 \times 1$ blocks (equal to $\pm1$) and $2 \times 2$ rotation matrices**.

  f(x) = x² – (3/4)x⁴ + ⋯,
so for small x the dominant term is x².
